perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this agreement after 3 years following the effective date.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this agreement after 3 years following the effective date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Consultant may terminate this agreement at any time with 30 days written notice for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating the agreement can be terminated after 3 years by either party, but then allowing the Consultant to terminate at any time with 30 days notice. This creates uncertainty regarding the termination clause.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration for all duties and obligations contained herein, on or before the Effective date above, Company shall issue to Consultant a warrant to purchase 4,400,000 shares of the Company's common stock, which is equal to 10% of the issued and outstanding shares of common stock of the Company at the time of the grant.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for all duties and obligations contained herein, Company shall issue to Consultant a warrant to purchase 4,400,000 shares of the Company's common stock, which is equal to 10% of the issued and outstanding shares of common stock of the Company at the time of the grant. The timing of this issuance is at the sole discretion of the company's board.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates ambiguity. The original text suggests a clear obligation, but the added clause introduces uncertainty about when the warrant will be issued, potentially conflicting with the consultant's understanding of timely compensation.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant will not, during the Term, and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, directly or indirectly: (i) solicit, recruit or promote the solicitation or recruitment of any employee or consultant of the Company for the purpose of encouraging that employee or consultant to leave the Company's employ or sever an agreement for services; or (ii) solicit, participate in or promote the solicitation of any of the Company's clients, customers, or prospective customers with whom Consultant had a Material Contact (hereinafter defined) and/or regarding whom Consultant received Confidential Information, for the purpose of providing products or services ("Competitive Products/Services"). "Material Contact" means interaction between Consultant and the customer, client or prospective customer within one year prior to Consultant's separation of services from the Company that takes place to manage, service or further the business relationship. This limitation is not intended to limit the Company's right to prevent misappropriation of its Confidential Information beyond the non-solicitation period.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant will not, during the Term, directly or indirectly: (i) solicit, recruit or promote the solicitation or recruitment of any employee or consultant of the Company for the purpose of encouraging that employee or consultant to leave the Company's employ or sever an agreement for services; or (ii) solicit, participate in or promote the solicitation of any of the Company's clients, customers, or prospective customers with whom Consultant had a Material Contact (hereinafter defined) and/or regarding whom Consultant received Confidential Information, for the purpose of providing products or services ("Competitive Products/Services"). "Material Contact" means interaction between Consultant and the customer, client or prospective customer within one year prior to Consultant's separation of services from the Company that takes place to manage, service or further the business relationship. This limitation is not intended to limit the Company's right to prevent misappropriation of its Confidential Information beyond the non-solicitation period. Notwithstanding the preceding sentences, the non-solicitation period shall only apply if the Consultant has been employed for at least two (2) years.
perturbation.explanation: This modification contradicts the original non-solicitation clause. Originally, the non-solicitation applied during the term and for one year after. The added sentence introduces a condition that the non-solicitation only applies if the consultant has been employed for at least two years. This creates uncertainty on whether the non-solicitation clause is valid if the consultant is employed for less than two years, leading to potential disputes.
